description.narrative:
Skatteverket har lämnat in en ansökan om SEK 1 046 000 för att genomföra en förberedande studie ”Preparatory study Skatteverket Ukraine” i Ukraina under perioden 2018-2019. Skatteverket var en del av TADAT-missionen till Ukraina under februari 2018 (TADAT, Tax Administration Diagnostic and Assessment Tool). Skatteverket är villigt att delta i ett större program kring institutionellt samarbete med dess ukrainska motsvarighet State Fiscal Service of Ukraine (SFS). De inledande diskussionerna mellan Skatteverket och SFS ägde rum i Stockholm under en konferens om kapacitetsutveckling på beskattningsområdet som ägde rum 30-31 maj 2018. SFS har även lanserat dess strategiska initiativ fram till 2020 (SFS Strategic Initiative).
Insatsen syftar till att lägga grunden för designen av ett program kring institutionellt samarbete mellan Skatteverket och SFS, inklusive förväntade resultat, risker samt planerade aktiviteter. Skatteverket kommer att implementera insatsen som är uppdelad i två faser: under fas 1 identifieras samarbetsområden samt samarbetsviljan; och under fas 2 utvecklas projektdokumentet för vidare samarbete.
Insatsens budget uppgår till SEK 1 046 000 och Sida är ensam givare.
Aktivitetsperioden är 1.09.2018 - 31.01.2019 Avtalsperioden är 1.09.2018 - 31.07.2019

The Swedish Tax Agency (STA) has applied to the Embassy of Sweden in Ukraine for funding of SEK 1 046 000 to carry out the "Preparatory study Skatteverket Ukraine" in Ukraine during the period 2018-2019. STA has been part of the TADAT (Tax Administration Diagnostic and Assessment Tool) mission to Ukraine in February 2018. STA is willing to participate in a bigger program of institutional cooperation with the State Fiscal Service of Ukraine. The initial discussions between the STA and the SFS took place in Stockholm during the Conference on Capacity Building concerning Taxation on 30-31 May, 2018. In its turn, the SFS has announced the SFS Strategic Initiatives until 2020.
The intervention aims at laying the foundation for designing a proposal for the program of institutional cooperation between the Swedish Tax Agency (STA) and the State Fiscal Service of Ukraine (SFS) including expected results, risks, planned activities. The Swedish Tax Agency will implement the intervention. The intervention will be organised in 2 phases: phase 1 is to identify the areas of cooperation and assess the will for cooperation, and phase 2 is to develop the project document for further cooperation.
The intervention’s total budget is SEK 1 046 000. The intervention is solely financed by Sida.
The activity period is 1.09.2018 - 31.01.2019 The agreement period is 1.09.2018 - 31.07.2019

The objective of the intervention was to lay the foundation for designing a proposal for the program of institutional cooperation between the Swedish Tax Agency and the State Fiscal Service of Ukraine including expected results, risks, planned activities etc. The Swedish Tax Agency wasl implementing the intervention. The intervention was supposed to be organised in 2 phases: - phase 1 is to identify the areas of cooperation and assess the will for cooperation, and - phase 2 is to develop the project document for further cooperation. A draft project document, in close cooperation with State Fiscal Service of Ukraine, should have been delivered to the Embassy of Sweden in Kyiv not later than 31 January 2019.

description.narrative: The results achieved include the following: 1. During Sept 2018 - December 2019, there has been the following visits between Swedish Tax Agency (STA) and State Fiscal Service of Ukraine (SFS): - STA visit to Kyiv, Ukraine on 10-14 September, 2018; - SFS visit to Stockholm, Sweden 4-10 November 2018; - STA visit to Kyiv, Ukraine 14-18 January 2019; - STA visit to Kyiv, Ukraine 22-26 July, 2019; 2. STA submitted the first draft proposal in May 2019 (the deadline was 31 January 2019) but received Embassy's comments for substantial improvement in terms of substance (create Workplan, Risk matrix, Results matrix, Budget with units and cost per unit etc). STA asked for cost extension to do the additionall work on proposal, and the Embassy granted the cost extension of SEK 1.2 million. The second more elaborate draft proposal was submitted in December 2020. After this, there has been still continuous dialogue on further proposal improvement in terms of mainstreaming Sida development perspective and anti-corruption, and budget structure set up that would allow a clear budget follow up etc. The last draft proposal with all annexes was submitted on 25 May 2020 even with the activity period for the new 3-year contribution (Plan-it 12787) started 1 January 2020. In addition to the above cost extension, the Embassy also made 2 no-cost agreement amendments to: 1) extend the activity period from 31 January 2019 to 1 September 2019, and 2) approve the reallocation between fees and reimbursables of SEK 54 309.81 as requested in by STA. The Embassy's experience is that the preparation of the project required quite a lot of efforts and time from the Embassy side to bring the proposal to the Sida standards, as well as manage administratively the agreement no-cost and cost extensions.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
